pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Ah, I wasn't paying attention and also started on this. Only got as far as the second theorem, though:
```diff
--- Mathlib/Analysis/Convolution.lean
+++ Mathlib/Analysis/Convolution.lean
@@ -123,13 +123,17 @@ variable [AddGroup G] [TopologicalSpace G]
 theorem convolution_integrand_bound_right_of_le_of_subset {C : ℝ} (hC : ∀ i, ‖g i‖ ≤ C) {x t : G}
     {s u : Set G} (hx : x ∈ s) (hu : -tsupport g + s ⊆ u) :
     ‖L (f t) (g (x - t))‖ ≤ u.indicator (fun t => ‖L‖ * ‖f t‖ * C) t := by
-  refine' le_indicator (fun t ht => _) (fun t ht => _) t
+  -- Porting note: added `suffices`
+  suffices (fun t => ‖(L (f t)) (g (x - t))‖) ≤ indicator u (fun t ↦ ‖L‖ * ‖f t‖ * C) by
+    apply this t
+  refine' le_indicator (fun t _ => _) (fun t ht => _)
   · refine' (L.le_op_norm₂ _ _).trans _
-    apply mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_left (hC _) (mul_nonneg (norm_nonneg _) (norm_nonneg _))
+    apply mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_left (hC _) (mul_nonneg (norm_nonneg L) (norm_nonneg _))
   · have : x - t ∉ support g := by
       refine' mt (fun hxt => _) ht
       apply hu
-      refine' ⟨_, _, set.neg_mem_neg.mpr (subset_closure hxt), hx, _⟩
+      refine' ⟨_, _, Set.neg_mem_neg.mpr (subset_closure hxt), hx, _⟩
+      simp only
       rw [neg_sub, sub_add_cancel]
     rw [nmem_support.mp this, (L _).map_zero, norm_zero]
 #align convolution_integrand_bound_right_of_le_of_subset convolution_integrand_bound_right_of_le_of_subset
@@ -137,8 +141,8 @@ theorem convolution_integrand_bound_right_of_le_of_subset {C : ℝ} (hC : ∀ i,
 theorem HasCompactSupport.convolution_integrand_bound_right_of_subset (hcg : HasCompactSupport g)
     (hg : Continuous g) {x t : G} {s u : Set G} (hx : x ∈ s) (hu : -tsupport g + s ⊆ u) :
     ‖L (f t) (g (x - t))‖ ≤ u.indicator (fun t => ‖L‖ * ‖f t‖ * ⨆ i, ‖g i‖) t := by
-  apply convolution_integrand_bound_right_of_le_of_subset _ (fun i => _) hx hu
-  exact le_ciSup (hg.norm.bdd_above_range_of_has_compact_support hcg.norm) _
+  refine convolution_integrand_bound_right_of_le_of_subset _ (fun i => ?_) hx hu
+  exact le_ciSup (hg.norm.bddAbove_range_of_hasCompactSupport hcg.norm) _
 #align has_compact_support.convolution_integrand_bound_right_of_subset HasCompactSupport.convolution_integrand_bound_right_of_subset
 
 theorem HasCompactSupport.convolution_integrand_bound_right (hcg : HasCompactSupport g)
```
@Ruben-VandeVelde After a few merge conflicts, I started pushing to github & opening a PR right after running `start_port.sh`.

This file is incredibly slow since [`MeasureTheory.Measure`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Measure/MeasureSpaceDef.html#MeasureTheory.Measure) is overloaded with [`Measure`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/WF.html#Measure), that alone probably adds multiple minutes of compile time in this file.
What should we do? Introduce `local notation "Measure" := MeasureTheory.Measure`? Something else? Ask core devs to add a namespace to `_root_.Measure`? (is it an option?)
I started https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Measure.20is.20overloaded/near/366584965

`local notation "Measure" => MeasureTheory.Measure` would be nice, but it doesn't work. It still considers `_root_.Measure`. I think as a workaround I'll just search-and-replace `Measure` to `MeasureTheory.Measure` (with a porting note).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  Build succeeded!

  The publicly hosted instance of bors-ng is deprecated and will go away soon.

  If you want to switch to GitHub's built-in merge queue, visit [their help page][gh].

  [instructions]: https://github.com/bors-ng/bors-ng#how-to-set-up-your-own-real-instance
  [the forum]: https://forum.bors.tech
  [gh]: https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/configuring-branches-and-merges-in-your-repository/configuring-pull-request-merges/managing-a-merge-queue



  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5336053774/jobs/9670168360)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5336053774/jobs/9670168772)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5336053774/jobs/9670168946)
LGTM, if all other review comments are also addressed.
Looks mostly good to me aside from the comments below (and Floris' naming suggestion). Is the file fast enough now with the `MeasureTheory.Measure` change?
I didn't finish the review yet, but I pushed some changes. The `MeasureTheory.Measure` fix speeds the file up by much more than 2x.
Looks mostly good to me aside from the comments below (and Floris' naming suggestion). Is the file fast enough now with the `MeasureTheory.Measure` change?
LGTM, if all other review comments are also addressed.

```suggestion
    AEStronglyMeasurable (uncurry fun x y => L₃ (f y) (L₄ (g x) (k (x₀ - y - x))))
      (μ.prod ν) := by
```
I prefer `le_of_op_norm_le_of_le2` or `le_of_op_norm_le_of_le_of_le` or something. There is no "le_op_norm" in this lemma. (Also: will we ever do anything with this porting note?)
I agree about the name. The note says that we didn't loose `#align`. Someone asked me to add a note like this when I was porting another file, so I started adding them.
I renamed to `le_of_op_norm₂_le_of_le`. Feel free to rename again.

I don't know what this line is doing here.
```suggestion
-- · exact K'.indicator fun t => ‖L'‖ * ‖f t‖ * ⨆ x, ‖fderiv 𝕜 g x‖
```
I guess, an edit artifact.
At the very least this should have a porting note, even if this increase seems reasonable for this declaration.
@Ruben-VandeVelde added this line. Redirecting.
What universe problem? There is not enough context in this porting note. Also, what is the purpose of the commented lines? Is this just to indicate what the old code was? Please indicate if so.
No longer needed, reverted.
Still, or is this now fixed?
Is this still an issue? If so, needs `porting note:`
Merged `master`, waiting for the CI.

```suggestion
```
that's because the tactic isn't ported right? Please indicate that instead if so.

No, it seems that `set` works differently in Lean 4 and `borelize` doesn't support it. UPD: looks like a bug in `borelize`, see [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/bug.20in.20.60borelize.60).
Merged `master`, works now.

```suggestion
theorem integral_posConvolution [CompleteSpace E] [CompleteSpace E']
```
(I know the statement doesn't actually mention `posConvolution`, though it should).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: port Analysis.Convolution
